docs.title: Channel Newsletter - Jan 2026
docs.text:
*Published: *

Welcome to the Jan 2026 edition of our Channel Newsletter!

docs.title: 📰 In This Issue
docs.text:
• Product Updates: Latest releases and announcements
  • Industry News: Market trends and insights
  • Partner Spotlight: Success stories from our community
  • Technical Resources: Documentation and guides
  • Upcoming Events: Webinars and conferences

docs.text:

This issue has been archived and is read-only.

docs.title: Newsletter Archive
docs.text: Browse previous newsletter issues using the version selector at the top of the page.

docs.title: Available Versions
docs.text: All published newsletter versions are listed in the version selector. Each version represents a monthly issue that has been archived and is read-only.

docs.title: Version Format
docs.text:
• Jan.2026 - January 2026 issue
  • Feb.2026 - February 2026 issue
  • And so on...

docs.title: Search Archive
docs.text: Use the search function to find specific topics across all newsletter versions.

docs.title: Technical Details
docs.text:
• Environment: UV virtual environment (.venv/)
  • Version Control: Mike for documentation versioning
  • Deployment: GitHub Pages with automated workflows

docs.title: Current Newsletter Issue
docs.text:
This page will contain the current month's newsletter content.

Use the newsletter manager script to create and deploy monthly issues:

# Create next month's newsletter
./scripts/newsletter-manager.sh create-next

# Deploy a newsletter version
./scripts/newsletter-manager.sh deploy Jan.2026

# Check UV environment status
./scripts/newsletter-manager.sh env-status

docs.title: Version Control with UV
docs.text: Each newsletter issue is version-controlled using Mike with UV environment: - Previous issues are archived and read-only - Version selector allows browsing all issues - Each version has its own URL path - Fast dependency management with UV

docs.title: Development Workflow
docs.text:
1. Environment Setup: UV creates and manages virtual environment
  2. Content Creation: Templates generated for each month
  3. Version Control: Mike handles version archiving
  4. Deployment: Automated deployment to GitHub Pages
